{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-364-01-A |Item_parent=Fractures in children: epidemiological, diagnostic and therapeutic features |Item_parent_short=Fractures in children: epidemiological, diagnostic and therapeutic features |Rank=A |Title=General information on fractures: understanding typical fractures in children |Description=Familiarising children with typical fractures |Rubric=Definition |Contributors=Bruno Dohin |Order=1}} Knowledge of epiphyseal fracture-decollement according to the Salter and Harris classification Be familiar with the types of fracture specific to children: subperiosteal, green wood, butterball, etc. Knowing about apophyseal avulsion fractures
.

question.question: Which type of fracture is characterized by a fracture through the growth plate (physis) and the epiphysis, according to the Salter and Harris classification?
question.option_a: Type I: Fracture through the growth plate
question.option_b: Type II: Fracture through the growth plate and metaphysis
question.option_c: Type III: Fracture through the growth plate and epiphysis
question.option_d: Type IV: Fracture through the metaphysis and epiphysis
